titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Michael Dietz, Transcript
CWG7306

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth of Kentucky
City Court of Louisville
Pleas held before the Hon Jas P Harbeson Judge of the City Court of Louisville on the 22nd day of August 1865
Be it remembered that on this day the Grand Jury of this Court returned into Court the following verdict against the Defendant Michael Dietz, viz

"City Court of Louisville
Commonwealth of Kentucky August Term 1865
vs } Indictment
Michael Dietz

The Jurors of the Grand Jury empannelled and sworn to enquire in and for the body of the City of Louisville in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, upon their oaths prescribeaccuse Michael Dietz of the offense of selling intoxicating liquors to James E Sanders, who is a white child under the age of twenty one years, and that said selling was done without the written consent of the Father mother or guardian of said Sanders -- in said City and State on the -- day of august 1865 against the Statute in such case made and provided

And thereafter on the 9th day of Novr 1865, said Indictment coming on for trial the Defendant plead not guilty, Whereupon a Jury came, who after hearing the testimony and retiring to consult &c returned into the Court the following verdict viz."We of the Jury find the Defendant guilty as charged in the within Indictment and assess his fine at fifty dollars to the Commonwealth of Kentucky and recommend him to Executive clemency" Whereupon it was ordered that said Dietz make his fine to the Commonwealth by the payment of Fifty dollars and all costs that may have accrued herein and that he be taken

A true Copy of the record in our
Attest Novr 13th 1865

Phil Tomppert Jr c. c. c. L.
by F Wobbe Depy clk

His Excellency,
Goven. T E Bramlette
There are many circumstances in this case which prompt me to ask a remission and I dare to hope for it

Your obt Servant
Jas P Harbeson
city Judge
W, G, Reasor
Atty
Please direct to clerk of Louisville City Court

Louisville City Ct
vs
Commonwealth
vs } Transcript
Michl Dietz
$50,
Selling liquor to a Minor
Remitted 14th Nov/65
